“This bill gives exclusive competences to the National Research Agency (NIA). NIA can take any person under its custody under the UAPA without prior permission from the state government. This is against federalism, which is guaranteed by the Constitution of India.”

“The labelling organizations as terrorist organizations and individuals as terrorists are very different. If a person receives the name of terrorist, he will face social exclusion and will lack opportunities to earn life even if he has shown the opposite. The consequences will be irreversible. For example, only in 2016 67% of cases ended in absolute, meaning they are probably innocent.”

“If someone is registered under the UAPA, the burden of proofing their innocence lies in them. This new amendment is allowing the government to confiscate its property. So how will they pay the legal expenses to prove their innocence, if they are false accused?”

“This will provide more police powers to the central government. The designation of people as terrorists can be used unfairly. For example, recently several civil activists are called Naxals Urban. “To prevent human rights violations, a four-step examination is added. India does not initiate the designation of people as terrorists. The United States, the European Union and China also have this disposition.”

So far, organizations were only designated as terrorist organizations, but not as individuals. The lagoon in this is that individuals from the prohibited organizations are forming new organizations and carrying out terrorist activities. This amendment to the Prevention of Illegal Activities Act allows the Government to designate people as terrorists, so terrorist attacks can be prevented.”
“It is necessary to act firmly against terrorism in the midst of the growing threats of terrorists. Therefore, it is necessary to strengthen the UAPA.”

“Today, India does not have a well-developed infrastructure to ensure data security. Moreover, developed countries already have efficient infrastructure. Therefore, rushing to the location of data may not be a wise step. Because without an efficient infrastructure, data is prone to cyber attacks. And the risk is serious here because it is financial data. But as the laws are made, it is a great challenge to develop efficient infrastructure at a faster pace.”

“Data storage in India means higher operating costs for payment system operators. In other countries there are cheap alternatives. And also for cross-border transactions, they have to store the data in two places, which increases the costs. There is the probability that these additional costs may impact consumers.”

Data localization laws lead to the creation of multiple data centers at the local level. This will create a lot of jobs and will enormously help the country’s economy. It will also drive innovation on the ground, which will lead to low-cost solutions.”

“When investigating the crimes, it will be necessary to access the payment data. If the data is stored abroad, it is very difficult to obtain permission from that country to access the data. This causes delays in the resolution of crimes. If the data is stored here within our country, this problem will be avoided.”

“India is a great consumer market for many foreign companies. Therefore, India and other developing countries are realizing the economic value of data and the importance of the location of data. With the location of data, the national companies and the country’s economy will benefit. And we can also guarantee the security of data.”

“Data is considered a ‘new form of wealth’. In general, companies use data to understand consumer requirements and also to influence their behavior. New products can be developed by analysing data to meet consumer needs. The data has an economic value. In general, developed countries are taking advantage of this opportunity with their well-developed infrastructure.”

“We are in a globalized world. Today, the world is working with the free flow of people, goods, services and data. Data location laws seem to be part of protectionist policies, which constitute a threat to the free flow of data.”

The U.S. It is contrary to the data location laws. Recently at the G20 summit, U.S. President Donald Trump spoke against the location of data. Its posture is natural because it increases the operating costs of U.S. companies. bilateral relations between India and the United States. They are important for both countries because we are interconnected in the export and import of IT services, professionals and goods, etc. Therefore, imposing data location laws without threatening Indo-American relations is another challenge.”
We can guarantee the privacy of the data by placing the data.
The location of data can lead to government surveillance of its citizens.
“Data location is important for data sovereignty, meaning that citizens’ data should be owned by their respective governments and not by other countries.”

“The law is very clear in the sense that RTI does not only deal with government bodies. It also corresponds to non-governmental organizations that are substantially financed and controlled by the Government. There are numerous subsidies (including tax exemptions) of which political parties enjoy, so they are substantially funded by the Government.”
“Political parties are independent organs, they don’t have to give accounts to the public. They were not established by the Constitution or by a law of the Parliament.”

“The IRR Act states that, wherever there is public interest, those organizations must be transparent and subject to the scope of law. There are a number of private organizations today, whether partially funded or entirely; schools, hospitals, etc. They are under the Anti-Terrorism Act and not just government organizations.”
There are appropriate provisions in the Income Tax Act and with the Electoral Commission so that people can have the information they want.

"Article 8 of the IRR Act contains provisions in which the concept of competitive interest is mentioned. Certain exemptions shall be provided in cases where it may be proven that the disclosure of information may harm the competitive advantage of the party. This is not just a problem with political parties, but also many governmental and private bodies.”

“It is believed that political financing is the source of corruption. Citizens have the right to know where political parties come from to collect those funds, how they spend them and the basis of their decisions. The Crony capitalism will be enormously blocked if the political parties are carried under the RTI Act.”

“Under the IT Act, political parties do not need to reveal the donations they get below 20,000 INR. An informal 2010 study on 6 key political parties shows that they increased Rs 700 crore. 95% of the amount was collected for amounts below Rs 20,000. There is a great possibility that political parties take advantage of this lagoon in their benefit.”
“Political parties declare certain promises in their manifestations. After being elected, citizens have the right to know why the promises made by political parties have not been fulfilled.”

“Political parties are fundamental to the functioning of democracy. Political parties continue to form the government. Government policies are then governed by the party’s ideology. Therefore, it is essential that political parties fall under the scope of the ITR.”

“If political parties enter under the RTI, it will affect their good internal functioning. Rivals can use RTI to malign each other. Moreover, since political parties are not directly connected to the public, an IRT would be invalid.”

Although new programming languages are replacing the old, the basic concepts are the same for almost all programming languages. Thus, whoever has a degree in coding will have an advantage over the student of a non-IT background.”

“People change career even after working on a field for several years because our interests change. Therefore, when someone can do this while having so many personal responsibilities, it’s much easier for young people to learn a new skill.”

“The variable salary definitely increases the productivity of employees. High-performance people feel well compensated and rewarded for their efforts, while low-performance people also feel motivated to improve.”

“In the variable remuneration regimes, employees feel satisfied and motivated with their work. They feel an active part of the organization, the organization recognizes them as part of their growth and appreciates their efforts.”

“The variable remuneration helps keep valuable employees. This helps to retain good talent for long periods of time and, therefore, to spend less on hiring new talents. This provides stability to the organization.”

“It has been seen that it is difficult to retain employees in times of shortage when they are in variable remuneration systems. Workers who receive commissions do good when the business is good, but they do bad when the business is bad. In slow business times, even the main sellers might have difficulties in making enough sales to earn life decently. If the market is slow and employed workers cannot earn enough, they can look for other job opportunities. In times of shortage, fixed wages can be more effective to prevent employees from going through other opportunities.”

Variable wages can lead to unhealthy competition among employees. They become less willing to help each other. The team’s cooperation may be negatively affected. In the long run, relationships between colleagues can become bitter. While, in fixed remuneration schemes, employees can maintain cordial relationships at the office.”

“In most cases, sales jobs have a variable component. This could negatively affect the employee’s attitude towards customers. They can irrationally force customers only to get profits for themselves. They could exaggerate the price to customers only to get more profits. While an employee with a fixed salary would maintain healthy and positive relationships with customers, achieving the right balance in their approach.”

Because of social networks, we now have the opportunity to connect with many people, even if they don’t live in our area. Before social networks, we could interact with people from our town or the places we go to.”

“The NEET exam standardizes the entry criterion for medical education throughout the country. As a high score is required to enter the government’s medical faculty, the exam ensures meritocracy.”

But every year, less than 20% of students approve the exam. Therefore, it is very important to take measures to provide affordable and high quality medical education in India.”

“As the exam requires additional study, training centers are taking advantage of the situation and are charging rupias lakhs for training for the NEET exam. Therefore, because of this, students who cannot afford coaching are in disadvantage.”

A cash-free economy saves so much money for governments because printing money and sending money to banks requires money and human resources. It will also be eliminated the need to buy or rent land for ATMs. International payments will also be easier because there is no need to change currencies.
Cashless transactions leave digital footprints of financial transactions. They can be used to track illegal activities.
The COVID pandemic increased the number of non-cash transactions. They can prevent the spread of infectious diseases.

Non-cash transactions are registered by the banks. Thus, the data will reveal the critical data of people regarding where they spend money. The government can easily access the data of any person. It can result in mass surveillance programs. This is contrary to the right to privacy. Money in cash gives us anonymousness.”
A non-cash economy will increase the number of cyber crimes.
Technical problems in the bank can stop access to our money. This can interfere with our daily lives.

“The refugees are displaced by force. “Today, many countries are rejecting refugees by saying they represent an economic or security threat. “Many developed countries are spending so much money to protect their borders, but they don’t spend any money to protect the lives of refugees. More funds are needed to protect refugees.”
